newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy engineering unions seek partial pay deal.
newsitem.headline: Italy engineering unions seek partial pay deal.

text.p: Unions representing Italian engineering and metal workers said on Friday that they wanted to conclude talks in a bitter pay dispute with two of the three employers' organisations in the sector.
A joint statement from the FIM, FIOM and UILM unions said they had formally asked the two groups for a meeting "to assess the possibility" of striking a deal.
The groups, Intersind and Confapi, respectively represent small- and medium-sized businesses in the sector, accounting for about 550,000 of the industry's 1.7 million workers.

Talks stalled last year and the largest employers' federation, Federmeccanica, has since rejected government suggestions that workers should be given a 200,000 ($129) a month pay rise to cover the 1996-98 contract period.
Unions, which originally asked for 230,000 lire a month, have accepted the government's proposal, but management has stuck to its 139,000 lire offer.
